thread.title: “Why bother?”

author: news24.com
title: “Why bother?”
text:
The Department of Rural Development was in its last years financial budget allocated R 1,2 billion (that is One Thousand Million Rand) to be expended on projects that would have a positive impact on rural development, that has become a ‘forgotten son’ that has never had the privilege on being the return of the prodigal one.
Sad to say, the Department only expended R 700 million of this amounts, mostly on ventilation for open air toilets with the remainder of R 500 million never spent on any projects.
A total of 44 000 toilets were given open air ventilation which is noble, but what about the fact that citizens need to have faeces to deposit into the toilets, and with a lack of work, business opportunities, and unemployment the toilets, will basically become ‘white elephants’ literally and figuratively.
Other rural infrastructure projects could have been addressed to if the ruling party had any real inclination, (proclivity, penchant, partiality, fondness, tendency, and leaning) to really add value to the lives of the ones that they so vehemently (fervent, passionate, intense, and vigorously) depend on when voting time comes around.
And all that the Department could do was to expend on toilets, with no lack of vision, no consideration of the dire needs and wants that the ones in rural areas so desperately need – their main objective being toilets, toilets and more toilets, with some toilets even being erected where there are no houses within meters from the toilets, standing in rows, on end, with not a sole in sight.
If this is just not another absolute waste of money, that is synonymous to bad planning and or administration, with someone ‘financially scoring in process’ then one need to get spectacles to be able to see how you are being fooled, fooled and one more fooled, and just nothing done to better the lives of those in the rural areas, which has become so obvious and only counts when votes are to be cast, then all those in the rural areas are suddenly brought the fore and promises, empty as they may be, made time after time, time and again,
